title: Springpath Unveils Findings from Company’s VMworld 2015 Survey
text:
Submitted by admin on 9/24/2015 @ 8:02 AM   Springpath 
SUNNYVALE, Calif. -- (BUSINESS WIRE) -- Springpath Inc. , a pioneer in hyperconvergence software, today announced the results of its “VMworld 2015 Survey.” The informal survey, given to VMworld 2015 attendees that visited Springpath’s booth, highlights attendees’ level of familiarity with hyperconvergence and their key preferences in data management for IT infrastructure. Key findings revealed that the large majority of respondents are aware of hyperconvergence, and more than half already have plans for deployment. The top two drivers for respondents’ planned adoption include “simplifying deployment and scaling” and “reducing operational complexity.” 
The Springpath “VMworld 2015 Survey” found: More than 75 percent of respondents have some level of awareness of hyperconvergence. More than 50 percent of respondents already have plans to deploy hyperconvergence, with about 30 percent reporting immediate implementation within one year. Main drivers for deploying hyperconvergence included operational challenges, specifically simplifying deployment and scaling and reducing overall operational complexity (60 percent); virtual desktop infrastructure (VDI) initiatives (26 percent); and hardware upgrades (20 percent). Additional reasons for deploying hyperconvergence were DevOps initiative, virtualization initiatives, new application deployment and others. 
“The survey results are a good indicator that hyperconvergence is already here and is taking the industry by storm, said Ashish Gupta, vice president of marketing at Springpath. “With disruptive technologies, the market usually witnesses general interest followed by long-term plans of at least two years to implement. With Springpath, however, half of our participants for this survey already have specific plans to deploy hyperconvergence, with 30 percent planning to do so within a year.” 
Springpath’s hyperconvergence software dramatically lowers IT operational burden for variety of use cases including server virtualization, development and test environments, VDI, and remote offices and branch offices (ROBOs), while delivering a flexible and powerful hyperconverged solution. Springpath Data Platform is available on a subscription basis for as low as $4,000 per server per year end-user pricing. About Springpath 
Springpath is the pioneer in hyperconvergence software, turning standard servers of choice into a single pool of compute and storage resources. The Springpath Data Platform eliminates the need for network storage and intuitively integrates into existing management tools to maximize operational efficiency. Using adaptive scaling capabilities, customers can grow compute, caching or capacity resources independently, depending on their changing business needs. Springpath proactively monitors your infrastructure to ensure resilient, always-on availability. Using data management and optimization capabilities, Springpath customers experience transformative levels of resource utilization, accelerating the adoption of DevOps in their organization with truly agile IT infrastructure. For more information, visit www.springpathinc.com or follow us on Twitter @SpringpathInc . 
About the Survey 
This survey was conducted informally by Springpath, a pioneer in hyperconvergence software, via survey forms filled out on the VMworld 2015 tradeshow floor. Data was compiled from more than 700 VMworld 2015 attendees and respondents were able to pick more than one answer and not required to answer each question.
